intro: Seseli rigidum subsp. peucedanifolium, commonly known as the rigid seseli, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
